event.title: straddles the old course of the A30 road but a dual carriageway bypass now

data.event: Mitchell straddles the old course of the A30 road but a dual carriageway bypass now carries the traffic north of the village.
The original name was La Medeshole and the first recorded mention of the village was in a court case in 1234 establishing the legal status of an annual market on St Francis's Day.
A chapel of St Francis for the use of wayfarers existed from 1239 until its destruction at the Reformation.

event.title: was disenfranchised by the Reform Act 1832

data.event: From the Middle Ages on, the borough of Mitchell elected two members to the Unreformed House of Commons but was disenfranchised by the Reform Act 1832.
